Welcome to the UT Systems and Storage Lab. The lab is directed by Prof. Vijay Chidambaram.

Mission: To advance the state-of-the-art in storage and systems in the face of new challenges such as the explosion of data and new storage techologies. To train the next generation of computer scientists and engineers.

We strive to make our systems publicly available whenever possible; check out the code we have released. We aim to include both undergraduate and Masters students in active research. Currently, we have three PhD students, one Masters student, and seven undergraduate students working with the lab.

We thank Facebook and VMware for supporting our lab.

Recent News:
  • Jul 2017

    Dr. Chidambaram will be visiting and working with the VMware Research Group for a month (from mid-June) in the summer!

  • Jul 2017

    We presented CrashMonkey, CC-Log, and our storage energy study at HotStorage 17.

  • May 2017

    Received a Special Research Grant from UT Austin for our work on measuring energy consumption of storage!

This website is maintained by Vijay Chidambaram and Subrat Mainali.

Department of Computer Science at the University of Texas at Austin
